sn7.13:1.2: Vātehābādhika is a syntactic compound, “afflicted by winds” (vātehi). It is one of the illnesses noted at AN 10.60:7.4. In Ayurveda, diseases of the winds may have many causes, chief among them faulty digestion.
sn7.13:1.3: In DN 16:5.4.5 Upavāna was said to have been the Buddha’s carer for a long time. At DN 29:41.1 he is fanning the Buddha. At AN 5.166, Ānanda goes to Upavāṇa for support when he feels he has disappointed the Buddha. The events of this discourse are recalled by him in his verses at Thag 2.33.
sn7.13:1.5: Typically ghee or other oil is recommended rather than hot water.
